C. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 228</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:610 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 610 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50879.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A village</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hamlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a country-seat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis Cobiamacho, qui vicus inter Tolosam et Narbonem est, deverterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 177 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
videlicet: <entryFree id="n50880" type="main" key="vi^de_li^cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdēlĭcet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from videre licet; cf. scilicet from scire licet; v. scilicet <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; prop. it is easy to see, to comprehend</etym>, serving, like scilicet, to confirm and complete what precedes (but with the difference that scilicet indicates rather the false, and videlicet the true explanation; v. Zumpt, Lat. Gram. § 345 n.); <sense id="n50880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">it is easy to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifestly</hi>, etc. (class., but much less freq. than scilicet). </sense><sense id="n50880.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50880.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50880.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> on account of videre (only ante- and post-class.; for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 7</bibl>, the better read. is datae): <cit><quote lang="la">videlicet, parcum illum fuisse senem, qui dixerit ... Videlicet fuisse illum nequam adulescentem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 49</bibl></cit> and 51: <cit><quote lang="la">esse videlicet in terris primordia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed videlicet, eum vocabula rerum ignoravisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50880.4" n="(b)" level="5"> As a mere particle: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc enim est Negotiosus interdius: videlicet Solon est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videlicet propter divitias inditum id nomen quasi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic de nostris verbis errat videlicet, Quae hic sumus locuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae videlicet ille non ex agri consiturā, sed ex doctrinae indiciis interpretabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil dolo factum, ac magis calliditate Jugurthae, cui videlicet speculanti iter suum cognitum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50880.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Ellipt., in replies: <cit><quote lang="la">quid metuebant? Vim videlicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid horum se negat fecisse? Illud videlicet unum, quod necesse est, pecuniam accepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:33:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 33, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eorum ... quorum? Videlicet qui supra scripti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:54:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 54, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50880.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">it is easy to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is very plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forsooth</hi>, in an ironical or sarcastic sense, when the contrary is intended: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus videlicet salutaris consulatus, perniciosus meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo videlicet timidus et permodestus (Catilina) vocem consulis ferre non potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque censuit pecunias eorum publicandas, videlicet timens, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50880.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a mere complementary or explanatory particle, <hi rend="ital">to wit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">namely</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas scilicet in this sense is only post-Aug.): caste jubet lex adire ad deos, animo videlicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: venisse tempus iis, qui in timore <cb n="VIDE" /> fuissent, conjuratos videlicet dicebat, ulciscendi se, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 12, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale de Homero scribit Ennius, de quo videlicet saepissime vigilans solebat cogitare et loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viden: <entryFree id="n50881" type="main" key="vi^den'?"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭden'?</orth> v. video <sense id="n50881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
videns: <entryFree id="n50882" type="main" key="vi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophet</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">eamus ad videntem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samuel videns,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gad videns et Nathan propheta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 29, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
video: <entryFree id="n50883" type="main" key="vi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>vīdi, vīsum, 2</itype> (viden', i.e. videsne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 779</bibl>; <sense id="n50883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> viderier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:53:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 53, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidĕ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root vid-, vēda, know; vindāmi, find; cf. vēda-s, sacred book; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">i)d, vid-</foreign>, in <foreign lang="greek">ei)=don</foreign>, saw; <foreign lang="greek">oi)=da</foreign>, know; Germ. wissen; Engl. wit, wot</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, with the eyes (syn. cerno). </sense><sense id="n50883.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50883.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Tun' me vidisti? <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Atque his quidem oculis. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Carebis, credo, Qui plus vident, quam quod vident. <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Numquam hercle deterrebor, Quin viderim id quod viderim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 15 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clare oculis video,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos enim ne nunc quidem oculis cernimus ea, quae videmus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Considium, quod non vidisset, pro viso sibi renuntiasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres et pueri qui visum processerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut juvat pastas oves Videre properantes domum! Videre fessos vomerem inversum boves Collo trahentes languido!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:62 sq" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 62 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes atque videres Infernas errare canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 35</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ind.</hi> (poët.): <cit><quote lang="la">viden', ut geminae stant vertice cristae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viden' ut faces Splendidas quatiunt comas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 77</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides, ut tota tremor pertemptet equorum Corpora?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides ut ... Antennae gemant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sol sex mensibus continuis non videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se disertos visos esse multos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, praef. § 13; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis ante pedes ire viderer eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have the eyes open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be awake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.: De.</hi> Vide sis modo etiam. <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Visum'st, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50883.4" n="a" level="4"> Of things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Apenninus) Gallica rura videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et casus abies visura marinos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to experience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.5" n="b" level="4"> Of places, etc., <hi rend="ital">to look out on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afford a view of</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">triclinium hortum et gestationem videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.6" n="c" level="4"> Of the other senses, <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">vidistin' toto sonitus procurrere caelo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 49: <cit><quote lang="la">mugire videbis Sub pedibus terram et descendere montibus ornos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum videres Stridere secretā divisos aure susurros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naso poljam haec quidem videt plus quam oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi> on purpose, <hi rend="ital">to look at</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">vide sis signi quid siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 155</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, tali ubi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vide, os ut sibi distorsit carnufex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, si non os inpudens Videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">specta me, a threatening expression,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 19 al.</bibl></cit>: quin tu me vides? <hi rend="ital">only look at me!</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">see what I have done!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50883.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi> with the mind's eye, <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be aware</hi>, <hi rend="ital">know</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. percipio): ad te, ut video, comminus accessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem exitum ego tam video animo, quam ea, quae oculis cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte enim adulantem nemo non videt,</quote> <trans><tr>sees through</tr>, <tr>detects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dormientes aliquid animo videre videamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in somnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 71, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego, cur nolim, nihil video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vobis videtur is animus qui plus cernat et longius, videre se ad meliora proficisci: ille autem cui obtusior est acies non videre?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plus</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is qui illusus sit plus vidisse videatur,</quote> <trans><tr>to have seen farther</tr>, <tr>had more insight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videre acutius atque acrius vitia in dicente quam recta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena melius videre et dijudicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 97</bibl></cit> (95): cum me vidisse plus <cb n="VIDE" /> fateretur, se speravisse meliora, <hi rend="ital">that I had seen farther</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 39</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem vos plus in re publicā vidistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos universos in consule deligendo plurimum vidisse fateantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di vatesque eorum in futurum vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem virum Crassum vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum conjunctione me privatum videbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum invidiosum se propter nimias opes viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ind.</hi> (poët.): <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides, croceos ut Tmolus odores, India mittit ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 56</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50883.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50883.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to think</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reputo, considero): duae condiciones sunt: utram tu accipias, vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ea videamus, quae contra ab his disputari solent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id primum videamus, quātenus amor in amicitiā progredi debeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed videamus Herculem ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit> Klotz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem et haec videnda et pecuniae fugienda cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te moneo: videas etiam atque etiam et consideres, quid agas, quo progrediare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi Bruti epistolam non prudenter rescriptam: sed ipse viderit,</quote> <trans><tr>let him see to that himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 371</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 43</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam id recte faciam, viderint sapientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (ars) quam sit facilis, illi viderint, qui, etc.... deinde etiam tu ipse videris, qui eam artem facilem esse dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viderint ista officia viri boni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 17, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look out for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque idem (sapiens) ita acrem in omnis partis aciem intendit, ut semper videat sedem sibi ac locum sine molestiā vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antecesserat Statius, ut prandium nobis videret,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>provide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulciculae potionis aliquid videamus et cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud lenius (vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippum dixisse constabat, videndum sibi aliud esse consilium, illo senatu se rem publicam gerere non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absque eo esset, Recte ego mihi vidissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see to it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make sure</hi>, with final clause: <cit><quote lang="la">navem idoneam ut habeas, diligenter videbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videret, ut quam primum tota res transigeretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fortuna mea desit, videte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum est, ne absit benignitas ... tum, ut pro dignitate cuique tribuatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Latine loquamur, non solum videndum est ut verba efferamus ea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos videte, quid aliae faciant isto loco feminae: et ne, cum velitis, exire non liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.14" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To see</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50883.15" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suo toto consulatu somnum non viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.16" n="b" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live to see</hi> a period or event: <cit><quote lang="la">ex multis diebus, quos in vitā celeberrimos laetissimosque viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam eum diem videam, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duxi uxorem: quam ibi miseriam vidi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero multa vos liberosque vestros in re publicā bona esse visuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas jam summorum imperatorum clarissimas victorias aetas nostra vidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum pro! degeneramus a parentibus nostris, ut praeter quam oram illi Punicas vagari classes dedecus esse imperii sui duxerint, eam nos nunc plenam hostium jam factam videamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 14, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.17" n="5" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">go to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visit</hi> (colloq.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viso, inviso): sed Septimium vide et Laenatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re etiam Othonem vide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbis ergo hominem, si voles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane videas Plinium domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to receive attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be visited</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50883.18" n="6" level="3"> Me vide, <hi rend="ital">rely on me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trust me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe me</hi>, a formula of exhortation and assurance (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 79</bibl> Brix ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 23</bibl> Lorenz ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.19" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be looked upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">regarded</hi> in any manner, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to seem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi> to be or do any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam periculi fugā committendum est, ut imbelles timidique videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1989" /> <cb n="VIDE" /> 24, 83: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id, quod speciem haberet honesti, pugnaret cum eo, quod utile videretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo rem turpiorem fore et iniquiorem visum iri intellegebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo illorum beata mors videtur, horum vita laudabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—Parenthet. (cf. c. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ceteris, ut quidem videor, tum mihi ipse displiceo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea vocabula non, ut videntur, easdem res significant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34, 84</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae quibusdam admirabilia videntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna mihi res cum omnium cognitione tum nostrā familiaritate visa est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idonea mihi Laelii persona visa est, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a naturā mihi videtur potius quam ab indigentiā orta amicitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Aristoni et Pyrrhoni omnino visa sunt pro nihilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod idem Scipioni videbatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—Parenthet. (cf. c. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">quam nostris libris satis diligenter, ut tibi quidem videmur, expressimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philargyrus omnia de te, ut mihi quidem visus est, narravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.20" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de familiari illo tuo videor audisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis facere rei publicae videmur, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut beate vixisse videar, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem e mundo tollere videntur, qui amicitiam e vitā tollunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videre jam videor populum a senatu disjunctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te vero, Caecili, quem ad modum sit elusurus, videre jam videor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere videor posse contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire videor undique congerentes nomina poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 61</bibl> (69), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:17:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 17, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videor mihi perspicere ipsius animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi videor videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:57:171" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 57, 171</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50883.21" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exstinctae potius amicitiae quam oppressae esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tamquam a praesentibus coram haberi sermo videretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sapientia) videtur in hominem cadere posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 100</bibl></cit>: visus 'st in somnis pastor ad me adpellere, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Aratus ab Jove incipiendum putat, ita nos rite coepturi ab Homero videmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitior mihi et affluentior videtur esse vera amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.22" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">creditur, in the same constr., and dicitur): non mihi videtur, ad beate vivendum satis posse virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis videtur, non incohatam sed perfectam probationem hoc nomen accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vult videri, se esse prudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia videbatur et Limnaeam eodem tempore oppugnari posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 13, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed mihi contra ea videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seque facile, ut mihi videtur, expediunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.23" n="b" level="4"> In official decisions, as a guarded opinion instead of a positive declaration: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri voluerunt, quae jurati judices cognovissent, ea non ut esse facta, sed ut videri pronuntiarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisse videri pronuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pontifices decressent, videri posse sine religione eam partem areae mihi restitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul adjecit Senatusconsultum, Ambraciam non videri vi captam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionis sententiam sequuntur, uti ante certam diem Caesar exercitum dimittat: si non faciat, eum adversus rempublicam facturum videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50883.24" n="c" level="4"> Pregn., videtur (alicui), <hi rend="ital">it seems proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it seems good</hi> to any one; <hi rend="ital">he</hi> (<hi rend="ital">she</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">pleases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50883.25" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi si videbitur, villis iis utere, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim Lentulum puerum visas eique de mancipiis, quae tibi videbitur, attribuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui imitamur, quos cuique visum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consul, quem videretur ei, cum imperio mitteret, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 20, 4</bibl>: si ei videretur, integram rem ad senatum reiceret, <hi rend="ital">if he pleased</hi>, a formula of politeness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 16, 4</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; <cit><quote lang="la">31, 4, 2: ut, si videretur ei, maturaret venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 46, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.26" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi visum est, sub vesperum dispersi discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: eam <cb n="VIEN" /> quoque, si videtur, correctionem explicabo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, si videtur, hoc, illud alias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Num non vis audire, etc.? <hi rend="ital">A.</hi> Ut videtur, <hi rend="ital">as you will</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 22, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vidualis: <entryFree id="n50884" type="main" key="vi^du^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vidua</etym>, <sense id="n50884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a widow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">widow-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitia, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 26: depeculator depositi vidualis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 40, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viduatus: <entryFree id="n50885" type="hapax" key="vi^du^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>viduo</etym>, <sense id="n50885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">widowhood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viduertas: <entryFree id="n50886" type="hapax" key="vi^du^ertas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭertas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>viduus</etym>, <sense id="n50886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lack of fruits of the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dearth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sterility</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
viduitas: <entryFree id="n50887" type="main" key="vi^du^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bereavement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lack.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n50887.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium copiarum atque opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50887.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">widowhood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 291, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vidularia: <entryFree id="n50888" type="main" key="Vidulari^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vidularĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a lost comedy by Plautus.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vidulus: <entryFree id="n50889" type="main" key="vidu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vidŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a travelling-trunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portmanteau</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wallet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:60 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 60 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 86</bibl>; 4, 4, 89 sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viduo: <entryFree id="n50890" type="main" key="vi^du^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>viduus</etym>, <sense id="n50890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereave</hi> of any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n50890.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">civibus urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornos foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva pruinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem pristino alimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna (Plutonis) lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:601" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexteram ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 866" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 866</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:385" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritum amplexibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154, 38</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">architectus ingeni viduatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orba pedum partim, manuum viduata vicissim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 840</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50890.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereft of her husband</hi>, <hi rend="ital">widowed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippina viduata morte Domitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:31:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 31, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux viduata taedis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>divorced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 581" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 581</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viduus: <entryFree id="n50891" type="main" key="vi^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. vidhava, without a husband; cf. ve- in vecors, etc.; <foreign lang="greek">h)i/+qeos</foreign>, single</etym>, <sense id="n50891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bereft of a husband</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereft of a lover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spouseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mateless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">widowed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50891.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (Penelopa) tam diu vidua viro suo caruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidui viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidve tibi prodest viduas dormire puellas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit> (3, 31), 17.—</sense><sense id="n50891.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a widow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nupta, vidua, virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitor viduarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbarum et viduarum tributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viduas avaras venari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>.—Of unmarried women: <cit><quote lang="la">se rectius viduam et illum caelibem futurum fuisse contendere quam cum impari jungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 245" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 215" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Med. 215</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:242:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 242, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50891.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50891.4" n="A" level="2"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">columba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 104</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50891.5" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus (Penelopes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelibatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So of a vine which is not trained to any tree, which stands alone: ut vidua in nudo vitis quae nascitur arvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 49</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and conversely, of trees which are without vines: et vitem viduas ducit ad arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:31" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50891.6" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">deprived</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bereft of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destitute of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi> any thing (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose); constr. with <hi rend="ital">a</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogor adire lacus viduos a lumine Phoebi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ipse viduus (i. e. viribus meis), Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 25: viduus pharetrā Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alni (i. e. naves) moderantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavus (gubernatore),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:5" default="NO">3, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulationes pecudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viduus mente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 120, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec viduum pectus amoris habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viduus teli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:247" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 247</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <trans><tr>desolate</tr>, <tr>without fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viduvium: <entryFree id="n50892" type="main" key="vi^du^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>viduus</etym>, <sense id="n50892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">widowhood</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 2</bibl>; Inscr. Don. cl. 10, n. 51.</sense></entryFree>
vienna: <entryFree id="n50893" type="main" key="Vi^enna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Rhodanus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vienne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:88:2 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 88, 2 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭennensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> <cb n="VIGI" /> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vienne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭennenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Vienne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:121" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:57 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 57 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
vieo: <entryFree id="n50894" type="main" key="vi^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n50894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ētum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root in Sanscr. vjā-, cover; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/tus</foreign>, border; cf. Lat. vitex, vitta, vimen, vitis, etc.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twist together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weave</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">viere vincire: a quo est in Sota Ennii: Ibant malaci viere Veneriam corollam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 62</bibl></cit> Müll. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 164</bibl> Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 189, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut habeas vimina, unde viendo quid facias, ut sirpeas, vallos, crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭētus</orth> (per synæresin scanned as a dissyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 7</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, prop., <hi rend="ital">bent together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent up;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">shrunken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrivelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrinkled</hi> (cf. viesco): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid vietum et caducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>decayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 385</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viesco: <entryFree id="n50895" type="hapax" key="vi^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭesco</orth>, <itype>cĕre</itype>, <sense id="n50895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vieo], <hi rend="ital">to shrink up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrivel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wither</hi> (cf. vietus): <cit><quote lang="la">viescens ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vietor: <entryFree id="n50896" type="main" key="vi^e_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭētor</orth>, v. vitor.</entryFree>
vietus: <entryFree id="n50897" type="main" key="vi^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>vieo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
vigeni: <entryFree id="n50898" type="main" key="vi_ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, v. viceni.</entryFree>
vigeo: <entryFree id="n50899" type="main" key="vi^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. ugras, mighty; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(gih/s</foreign>, sound; cf. Lat. vegeo, vigil, augeo</etym>, <sense id="n50899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be lively</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigorous; to thrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloom; to be in honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repute</hi>, etc. (class.; mostly of things, concrete and abstract; cf. valeo). </sense><sense id="n50899.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae a terrā stirpibus continentur, arte naturae vivunt et vigent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sentit, quod sapit, quod vivit, quod viget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:27:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive occiderit animus sive vigeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vegetum ingenium in vivido pectore vigebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volsci fessi ... Romani vigentes corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 30, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus Laetitiā viget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos animo duntaxat vigemus, etiam magis quam cum florebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā vigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viget aetas, animus valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama Mobilitate viget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec viget quicquam simile aut secundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: cujus facta viva nunc vigent, Naev. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigebant studia rei militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia, largitio, avaritia vigebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: tui politici libri omnes vigent, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>: quem (Philonem) in Academiā maxime vigere audio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is in the highest repute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 110</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harmodius in ore et Aristogito ... viget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum conciliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50899.2" n="II" level="1"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be alive</hi>: Persarum vigui rege beatior. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab tergo Alpes urgent, vix integris vobis ac vigentibus transitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigesco: <entryFree id="n50900" type="main" key="vi^gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgesco</orth>, <itype>gŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n50900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vigeo], <hi rend="ital">to become lively</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigorous; to thrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to flourish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bloom</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de niloque renata vigescere copia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 674</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:757" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 757</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam laeti studio pedes vigescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrae tum arae, vestrae religiones viguerunt, vestra vis valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu legiones Caesaris viguerunt, nunc vigent Pansae, vigent Hirtii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summis honoribus et multā eloquentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigesimus: <entryFree id="n50901" type="main" key="vi_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. vicesimus.</entryFree>
vigessis: <entryFree id="n50902" type="main" key="vi_gessis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgessis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>viginti-as</etym>, <sense id="n50902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twenty</hi> asses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:76:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 76, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 737</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigies: <entryFree id="n50903" type="spur" key="vi_gi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgĭes</orth>, <itype>a false reading for vicies</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 597</bibl> Kopp ad loc.</entryFree>
vigil: <entryFree id="n50904" type="main" key="vi^gil"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgil</orth>, <itype>ĭlis</itype> (<sense id="n50904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> vigilium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 33, 6</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vigeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">awake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alert</hi> (class.; cf.: insomnis, exsomnis). </sense><sense id="n50904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50904.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius orto Sole vigil calamum et chartas et scrinia posco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilum canum excubiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the cock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 148</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">wakeful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watchful</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>always burning</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernae,</quote> <trans><tr>night-lamps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri vigili bibere,</quote> <trans><tr>wakeful</tr>, <tr>listening</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50904.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgil</orth>, <itype>ĭlis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a watchman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentinel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor a vigilibus fanique custodibus tollitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 370</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 195</bibl></cit>.— <pb n="1990" /> <cb n="VIGI" /> Of such vigiles there were in Rome, from the time of Augustus, seven divisions, with their prefects and sub-prefects, constituting a regularly organized night-police, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:56" default="NO">47, 2, 56</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sentinel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi (sol et luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1436</bibl></cit> (1434).—Of cocks: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50904.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <trans><tr>wakeful</tr>, <tr>active</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 396</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">questus,</quote> <trans><tr>uttered by night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:196" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilabilis: <entryFree id="n50905" type="hapax" key="vi^gi^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vigilo</etym>, <sense id="n50905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wakeful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watchful</hi>: dormitio nostri pectoris, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 100, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilans: <entryFree id="n50906" type="main" key="vi^gi^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of vigilo.</entryFree>
vigilanter: <entryFree id="n50907" type="main" key="vi^gi^lanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vigilo, <sense id="n50907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vigilantia: <entryFree id="n50908" type="main" key="vi^gi^lanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vigilans, from vigilo</etym>, <sense id="n50908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wakefulness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n50908.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat (Plinii) incredibile studium, summa vigilantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—Jocosely: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit (Caninius) mirificā vigilantiā, qui suo toto consulatu somnum non viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n50908.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">watchful attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watchfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilance</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulitas, diligentia): Siciliam virtute istius et vigilantiā singulari ... tutam esse servatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilate: <entryFree id="n50909" type="main" key="vi^gi^la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vigilo <sense id="n50909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
vigilatio: <entryFree id="n50910" type="main" key="vi^gi^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vigilo</etym>, <sense id="n50910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wakefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleeplessness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:101" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilax: <entryFree id="n50911" type="main" key="vi^gi^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">watchful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50911.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Subura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 15.—</sense><sense id="n50911.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 779</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilia: <entryFree id="n50912" type="main" key="vi^gi^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n50912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭ-lĭum</orth>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 232, 4</bibl>) [vigil]. </sense><sense id="n50912.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50912.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">wakefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleeplessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lying awake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque vigilia praecesserit neque ventris resolutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum robora nocturnā vigiliā minuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui non sunt auditae Demosthenis vigiliae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>; id. Par. prooem. § 5.—</sense><sense id="n50912.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50912.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a keeping awake</hi> for the security of a place, esp. of a city or camp, <hi rend="ital">a watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">excubiae, statio): noctu vigilias agere ad aedes sacras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra tecta custodiis vigiliisque defendite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus stationibus vigiliisque fessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiles scutum in vigiliam ferre vetuit,</quote> <trans><tr>to take on guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiliarum nocturnarum curam per urbem magistratibus mandavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50912.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50912.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A watch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the time of keeping watch by night</hi>, among the Romans a fourth part of the night: <cit><quote lang="la">nox in quattuor vigilias dividitur, quae singulae trium horarum spatio supputantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 140, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā vigiliā capite arma frequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 34, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum puer tuus ad me secundā fere vigiliā venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tertiā vigiliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
