G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertiā vigiliā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 44, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quartā vigiliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50912.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The watch</hi>, i. e. those standing on guard, <hi rend="ital">watchmen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentinels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites disponit, non certis spatiis intermissis sed perpetuis vigiliis stationibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 25, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 45, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:100:4" default="NO" valid="yes">100, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50912.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A watching</hi> at religious festivals, <hi rend="ital">nightly vigils</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereris vigiliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50912.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">watchfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilance</hi> (the figure taken from military sentinels; perh. only in the foll. passages; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas vigilantia is far more freq.): ut vacuum metu populum Romanum nostrā vigiliā et prospicientiā redderemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi in vigiliā quādam consulari ac senatoriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: cupio jam vigiliam meam, Brute, tibi tradere: sed ita, ut ne desim constantiae meae, <hi rend="ital">my post</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">my office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 24, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: cum summis vigiliis aliquid perficere, Just. Inst. prooem. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
vigiliarium: <entryFree id="n50913" type="main" key="vi^gi^li^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50913.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A watchtower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 57:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 57, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50913.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small sepulchral monument in the shape of a watchtower</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4557</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilium: <entryFree id="n50914" type="main" key="vi^gi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. vigilia <sense id="n50914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vigilo: <entryFree id="n50915" type="main" key="vi^gi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n50915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [vigil]. </sense><sense id="n50915.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep awake</hi> at night, <hi rend="ital">not to sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be wakeful</hi> (class.; syn. excubo). </sense><sense id="n50915.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad multam noctem vigilare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximā nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cb n="VIGO" /> ad ipsum Mane, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 17</bibl>.—With a homogeneous object: in lectitando ... vigilias vigilare, Gell. N. A. praef. § 19.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeo si vigilatur et hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:68:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 68, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilat Troicus ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>burns continually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina (of a light-house),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 31</bibl></cit>.—Prov. </sense><sense id="n50915.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Hic vigilans somniat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">builds castles in the air</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 68</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">num ille somniat Ea, quae vigilans voluit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50915.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Qui imperata effecta reddat, non qui vigilans dormiat, <hi rend="ital">who dreams with his eyes open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goes to sleep over a thing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 152</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et vigilans stertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1048" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1048</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilanti stertere naso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeo, si vigilatur et hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:68:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 68, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50915.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50915.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be watchful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilantes curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi vigilantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 438</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50915.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to keep watch</hi> over any thing, <hi rend="ital">to be watchful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigilant</hi>: vigilandum est semper: multae insidiae sunt bonis, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 24, 59</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 138 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">excubabo vigilaboque pro vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigila, Chrysippe, ne tuam causam deseras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vivas, vigila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis vigilare severis,</quote> <trans><tr>to engage in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janitor ad dantes vigilet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 47: Mars, vigila, an invocation to Mars at the breaking out of a war, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50915.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend in watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make while watching</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">noctes vigilantur amarae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 169</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vigilata nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam breviorque dies et mollior aetas, Quae vigilanda viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen vigilatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:109" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilati labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magia occulta noctibus vigilata,</quote> <trans><tr>pursued by night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 304, 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50915.9" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">watchful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilantes et boni et fortes et misericordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilans et acutus tribunus plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilans et industrius homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, B, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">sentiet in hac urbe esse consules vigilantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo paratior, vigilantior, compositior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 11, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux (Hannibal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">watchfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 144</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilantissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15, 32</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50915.10" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭ-gĭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, for vigilanter, <hi rend="ital">watchfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viginti: <entryFree id="n50916" type="main" key="vi_ginti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīginti</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">XX</orth>.), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. vicati; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)/kosi</foreign>; Boeot. <foreign lang="greek">vi/kati</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n50916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twenty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti jam usu'st filio argenti minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si viginti quiessem dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos natus unum et viginti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blattae impositae diebus viginti uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 141</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (Mithridati) duas et viginti linguas traditur notas fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor hinc rapimur viginti et milia raedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 86</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
vigintiangulus: <entryFree id="n50917" type="hapax" key="vi_ginti^angu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgintĭ-angŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having twenty angles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigintivir: <entryFree id="n50918" type="main" key="vi_ginti^vir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgintĭvir</orth>, <itype>vĭri</itype>, v. vigintiviri.</entryFree>
vigintiviratus: <entryFree id="n50919" type="main" key="vi_ginti^vi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgintĭvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vigintiviri</etym>, <sense id="n50919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of the</hi> vigintiviri, <hi rend="ital">the vigintivirate;</hi> for the distribution of lands, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 16</bibl> Spald.—Of the inferior civil court, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl>.—Of a municipal court, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3970</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigintiviri: <entryFree id="n50920" type="main" key="vi_ginti^vi^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgintĭ-vĭri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a college</hi> or <hi rend="ital">board of twenty men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> vigintiviri. </sense><sense id="n50920.1" n="I" level="1"> Appointed by Cæsar during his consulship for distributing the Campanian lands, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 137" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 137</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 176</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50920.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inferior civil court</hi>, one half of whose members assisted the prætor, and the other half presided over the roads, the mint, and public executions, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Julian. 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2761</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3970</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50920.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A council of State</hi>, created A.D. 237, in opposition to Maximinus I., <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3042</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigor: <entryFree id="n50921" type="main" key="vi^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vigeo</etym>, <sense id="n50921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">liveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">activity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cæs. or Cic.): nec tarda senectus Debilitat vires animi mutatque vigorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 611</bibl></cit>: igneus est ollis <cb n="VILI" /> vigor, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 730</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventas et patrius vigor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum in illo (libro), di boni, vigoris est, quantum animi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 64, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <trans><tr>strong brilliancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 28, § 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 109</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigores mentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:355" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 355</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigoro: <entryFree id="n50922" type="main" key="vi^go_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vigor</etym>. <sense id="n50922.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to animate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invigorate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis vigoratus,</quote> <trans><tr>stout</tr>, <tr>lusty</tr>, <tr>vigorous</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50922.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum animae vigorantis ex vite Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 26 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vilesco: <entryFree id="n50923" type="main" key="vi_lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi</itype>, 3 <sense id="n50923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vilis], <hi rend="ital">to become worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis clarus homo vilescit in turbā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 22, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joan. 24:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joan. 24, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vilicatio: <entryFree id="n50924" type="main" key="vi_li^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. vilico, I.</etym>, <sense id="n50924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">management of an estate in the country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:27" default="NO">11, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proici de vilicatione suā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 121, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilicatus: <entryFree id="n50925" type="main" key="vi_li^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stewardship</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Qu. Evang. 2:45" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Qu. Evang. 2, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vilico: <entryFree id="n50926" type="main" key="vi_li^co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">villĭco</orth>; <sense id="n50926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> perh. not found), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.;</hi> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭ-cor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, āri</itype>, 1., <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>vilicus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50926.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50926.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To act as bailiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer; to superintend</hi> (prop. of a country estate). </sense><sense id="n50926.3" n="1" level="3"> Form vilico: <cit><quote lang="la">dispensare rem publicam, et in eā quodammodo vilicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50926.4" n="2" level="3"> Form vincor: non vilicari, sed dominari mea est sententia, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 2</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 45 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">longe ab urbe vilicari, quo erus rarenter venit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 186, 1: hic vilicor ante urbem: nunc rus eo, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 7</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 82 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n50926.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to live</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reside in the country.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50926.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: in Arpinos jam ... explodam hominem, ut vilicetur, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50926.7" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: ego nondum etiam hic vilicabar, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50926.8" n="3" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicatus praediis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50926.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to manage</hi> an estate, etc., <hi rend="ital">as a bailiff</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionem maximam illam vilicabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50927" type="main" key="vi_li^co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">villĭco</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. vilico, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one managing a farm; a bailiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi>, etc. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">neget eum rationibus viliconum, et upilionum, et equisonum sollertissime subscripsisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 329</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilicor: <entryFree id="n50928" type="main" key="vi_li^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. 1 vilico.</entryFree>
vilicus: <entryFree id="n50929" type="main" key="vi_li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">villĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>villa</etym>, <sense id="n50929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a countryhouse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">villa</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nomina lini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 56</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50929.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. homo). </sense><sense id="n50929.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An overseer of a farm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a steward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bailiff; absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 142</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 15</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilice silvarum et mihi me reddentis agelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicus Orbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50929.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an overseer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pegasus attonitae positus modo vilicus urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilici (sc. aquaeductum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 117" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum vilicum esse imperatorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 82, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AMPHITHEATRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 5</bibl></cit>, n. 3.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">A PLVMBO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2859</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AB ALIMENTIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1033, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50929.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. mulier), <hi rend="ital">a female overseer; the wife of an overseer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl>, praef. 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vilifico: <entryFree id="n50930" type="main" key="vi_li^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vilis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n50930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esteem of little value</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Isa. 15, 54, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilipendo: <entryFree id="n50931" type="hapax" key="vi_li^pendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭpendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vilis-pendo</etym>, <sense id="n50931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold in slight esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to depreciate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vilipend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilis: <entryFree id="n50932" type="main" key="vi_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of small price</hi> or <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchased at a low rate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheap</hi> (opp. carus). </sense><sense id="n50932.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam hic vile nunc est nisi mores mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annona vilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec (puella) vero vilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc verbum vile est viginti minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eis praediis talenta argenti bina Statim capiebat ... Ac rebus vilioribus multo talenta bina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum quoniam vilius erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 195</bibl></cit>: res vilissimae (opp. pretiosissimae),<pb n="1991" /> <cb n="VILL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 91</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl. neutr.</hi> (sc. pretio), <hi rend="ital">at a small price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a low rate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheaply: Ep.</hi> Quanti eam emit? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Vili, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vili vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:66:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 66, 10</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod viliori praedium distraxerit ... et si non viliori vendidit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:24:11:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 24, 11, § 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res stipulatoris vilissimo distracta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50932.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50932.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of trifling value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paltry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi> (cf. indignus): <cit><quote lang="la">si honor noster vobis vilior fuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 41, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam vile neque tam vulgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Velia non est vilior quam Lupercal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi quorum tibi auctoritas est videlicet cara, vita vilissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem fortunas pericula vilia habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec adeo vilis tibi vita esset nostra, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et genus et virtus nisi cum re vilior alga est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Perfectos veteresque referri debet an inter Viles et novos?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilis Europe,</quote> <trans><tr>vile</tr>, <tr>abandoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu poscis vilia rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, dum me careas, est tibi vile mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 48</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">et vile virentes Hesperidum risit ramos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the ordinary manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 37</bibl></cit>: vile comparati, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 145</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vile est, quod licet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50932.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: stat fucare colos nec Sidone vilior, Ancon. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:438" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 438</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50932.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Found in great quantities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phaselus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 227</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n50932.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">cheaply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire poteris intestinis vilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilissime constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilissime constiterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50932.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">meanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poorly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vilely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsum colere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 344, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilissime natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilitas: <entryFree id="n50933" type="main" key="vi_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vilis</etym>, <sense id="n50933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lowness of price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheapness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50933.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta repente vilitas annonae ex caritate rei frumentariae consecuta est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilitas in vendendis (fructibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alter annus in vilitate, alter in summā caritate fuerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 93</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">216: ad denarios senos vilitas rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 28, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerre aliquid vilitati,</quote> <trans><tr>to offer for sale at a low price</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50933.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50933.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Trifling value</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">meanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vileness</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20</bibl></cit>, praef. § 1: si humiles producet, vilitatem; <cit><quote lang="la">potentes, gratiam oportebit incessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 344, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50933.4" n="B" level="2"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">low esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disregard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slighting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contempt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilitas sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 121, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viliter: <entryFree id="n50934" type="main" key="vi_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vilis <sense id="n50934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vilito: <entryFree id="n50935" type="hapax" key="vi_li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vilis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make cheap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of little esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to humble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degrade</hi>: quae (vitia) te vilitant, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 185, 31</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 88 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
villa: <entryFree id="n50936" type="main" key="villa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villa</orth> (rustic, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vella</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 4</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>most prob. for vicula, from vicus</etym>, <sense id="n50936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country-seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villa.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50936.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl>; Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 1, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50936.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">Villa Publica, in the Campus Martius, as the gathering-place, rendezvous for recruits, and of the people for the census, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 22, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:24" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 24</bibl>.—As the residence of foreign ambassadors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 21, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 24, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50936.3" n="B" level="2"> = vicus, <hi rend="ital">a village</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
villaris: <entryFree id="n50937" type="main" key="villa_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>villa</etym>, <sense id="n50937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a country-seat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">villa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <trans><tr>reared at a country-seat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 41, 57, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
villaticus: <entryFree id="n50938" type="main" key="villa_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a country-house</hi> or <hi rend="ital">villa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">villaticum genus pastionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 17, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:13:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

villula: <entryFree id="n50944" type="main" key="villu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>villa</etym>, <sense id="n50944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little country-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small villa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 240, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
villum: <entryFree id="n50945" type="main" key="villum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>contr. from vinulum, from vinum</etym>, <sense id="n50945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sup of wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc villi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
villus: <entryFree id="n50946" type="main" key="villus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. urā, sheep; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)=ros</foreign>, wool; cf. vellus</etym>, <sense id="n50946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shaggy hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tuft of hair;</hi> of beasts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 63, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 446</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 352</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:136:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 136, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> al.—Of cotton, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsis mantelia villis,</quote> <trans><tr>the nap of cloth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 377</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 702</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vimen: <entryFree id="n50947" type="main" key="vi_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vieo</etym>, <sense id="n50947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pliant twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a switch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">osier</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50947.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:345 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 345 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50947.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50947.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip;</hi> of willow, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50947.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The staff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wand of Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50947.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Woven work</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a basket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve Picenorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:88:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 88, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vimentum: <entryFree id="n50948" type="hapax" key="vi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vimen</etym>, <sense id="n50948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an osier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withy</hi>, = vimen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viminalis: <entryFree id="n50949" type="main" key="vi_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to osiers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50949.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">salix,</quote> <trans><tr>bearing twigs for plaiting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 143</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50949.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj. propr.</hi>: Viminalis Collis, <hi rend="ital">one of the seven hills of Rome</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44</bibl>), so named from a willow-copse which stood there; whence, also, the Jupiter there worshipped was called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vīmĭnĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 51</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 1:19" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl> Müll.—The gate leading to it was called Viminalis Porta, Fest. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 1:19" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

L. 5:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 51</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

C. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces virgarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salix,</quote> <trans><tr>serving for wicker-work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 69, § 177</bibl></cit> (al. viminalis).</sense></entryFree>

R. 3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 11, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50958.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vī-nācĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a grape-skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 197</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50958.5" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnācĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50958.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A grape-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:69" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50958.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A grape-skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50958.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A wine - cup</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligunt vinacea uvarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Osee, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

vinariarius: <entryFree id="n50961" type="gloss" key="vi_na_ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnārĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vinarius</etym>, <sense id="n50961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine - dealer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VINARIARIVS VINARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4249</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinarius: <entryFree id="n50962" type="main" key="vi_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n50962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50962.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 14</bibl>. § <cit><quote lang="la">89: uter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 18, 73, § 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>relating to the duties on wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 9, 19</bibl></cit>: minister, <hi rend="ital">a cup - bearer</hi>, Hier. Chron. Euseb. ad ann. MDLXX. ab Abrah.—</sense><sense id="n50962.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50962.3" n="A" level="2"> <cb n="VINC" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wine-dealer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50962.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wine-bibber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 4</bibl>, §§ 2 and 25.—</sense><sense id="n50962.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wine-pot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine-flask</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 46</bibl> (Ritschl; cf. Brix ad loc.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vincapervinca: <entryFree id="n50963" type="main" key="vinca pervinca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinca pervinca</orth> (also in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vincapervinca</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">periwinkle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:172" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 27, 99, § 172</bibl>; called also simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">pervinca</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinceus: <entryFree id="n50964" type="spur" key="vince^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false read. for juncea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 56</bibl>; v. junceus.</entryFree>
vinciam: <entryFree id="n50965" type="main" key="vinciam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinciam</orth> <itype>dicebant continentem</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n50965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (in the Cod. Basil. in Barth. Adv. 39, 5, is added, et est cognomen Jovis).</sense></entryFree>
vincibilis: <entryFree id="n50966" type="main" key="vinci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinco</etym>. * <sense id="n50966.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can be easily gained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50966.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victorious</hi>: clangor, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of brazen implements in an eclipse of the moon</hi>, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. Burm. 2, p. 329.</sense></entryFree>
vincio: <entryFree id="n50967" type="main" key="vinci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincĭo</orth>, <itype>vinxi, vinctum</itype> (<sense id="n50967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part.</hi> vinciturus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 10</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wind about; to fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten; to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, etc. (class., esp. in the trop. sense; syn.: ligo, necto, constringo). </sense><sense id="n50967.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum aput te vinctum adservato domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc abduce, vinci, quaere rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres meos in vincula conjecit. Cum igitur eos vinxerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Dejot. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus est vincire civem Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Romani vincti Apronio traditi sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">37: trinis catenis vinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post terga manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotas ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmum appositis vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte suras purpureo cothurno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora novis floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">boves vincti cornua vittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anule, formosae digitum vincture puellae,</quote> <trans><tr>about to encircle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50967.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50967.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissis umeris esse, vincto pectore, ut, gracilae sient,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tightly laced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50967.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To compass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem quidem aiunt acerrime dilectum habere, loca occupare, vinciri praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 18, 2</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. vincire, i. e. loca).—</sense><sense id="n50967.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus vincta pruinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl></cit> (but the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:96" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 96</bibl>, is juncta; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n50967.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi Veneris vinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religione vinctus astrictusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si turpissime se illa pars animi geret ... si vinciatur et constringatur amicorum propinquorumque custodiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>.—Of sleep, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi vinctos somno velut pecudes trucidandos tradidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut somno vincta jacebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plaustra somno vinctos coniciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem multo Lyaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> (4, 4), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">inimica ora (magicis artibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:581" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectum certo foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 21</bibl></cit> (4, 19, 11): <cit><quote lang="la">spadonis animum stupro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse tuam vinctam numine teste fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pacto matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl></cit>.—Of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">membra (orationis) sunt numeris vincienda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>arranged rhythmically</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba vincta, oratio vincta (opp. soluta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:19" default="NO">9, 4, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinco: <entryFree id="n50968" type="main" key="vinco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinco</orth>, <itype>vīci, victum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. causat. of root <foreign lang="greek">ik-</foreign>; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)/kw</foreign>, to yield; but cf. per-vicax; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 106" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 106</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n50968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get the better of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be victorious</hi>, etc. (syn.: supero, debello). </sense><sense id="n50968.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50968.2" n="A" level="2"> In war or battle: <cit><quote lang="la">jus esse belli, ut qui vicissent, iis, quos vicissent, quemadmodum vellent, imperarent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginienses navalibus pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non virtute neque in acie vicisse Romanos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id vi et virtute militum victum atque expugnatum oppidum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicimus vi feroces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: aio te, Aeacida, Romanos vincere posse, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl> (Ann. v. 186 Vahl.): sicut fortis equus, spatio qui saepe supremo Vicit Olympia, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 14</bibl> (Ann. v. 442 ib.): aliquando<pb n="1992" /> <cb n="VINC" />  ut vincat, ludit assidue aleam, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. milia,</quote> <trans><tr>to win at play</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> ib. 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.3" n="B" level="2"> In a lawsuit, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be successful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tu horum nil refelles, vincam scilicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam suam,</quote> <trans><tr>to win</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 76</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum est: ventum est: vincimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.4" n="C" level="2"> In other relations, <hi rend="ital">to win</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be successful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 27, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:31:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 31, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicit iter durum pietas,</quote> <trans><tr>controlled</tr>, <tr>made easy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 688</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:23:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor omnia vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 145</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">difficultates, Auct. B. G. 8, 21: virgam,</quote> <trans><tr>to win</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicit tamen in Senatu pars illa, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factione respectuque rerum privatarum ... Appius vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in senatu vicisset sententia, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: Othonem vincas volo, <hi rend="ital">to outbid</hi> (in an auction), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 33, 2</bibl>.—To defeat as a candidate for office: <cit><quote lang="la">competitorem in suffragiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.5" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate subjects. </sense><sense id="n50968.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail over</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) neu turbine venti Vincantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victa ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam gurgitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincunt aequora navitae,</quote> <trans><tr>prevail against</tr>, <tr>get the better of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victaque concessit prisca moneta novae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:222" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quernaque glans victa est utiliore cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:676" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora victa sopore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:422" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 422</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">blanda quies furtim victis obrepsit ocellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi casses (linei) vel ferri aciem vincunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum turbā vincente,</quote> <trans><tr>overflowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:390" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 390</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To outlast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aesculus) Multa virum volvens durando saecula vincit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendo mea fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To surmount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra (sagittae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">montes ascensu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">of cooking: nec viscera quisquam ... potest vincere flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleas undis calefactas et prope victas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> Med. 319</bibl></cit>.—Of smelting ores: <cit><quote lang="la">metallorum primitiae nullis fornacibus victae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl></cit>.—Of melting snow: <cit><quote lang="la">nive, quae zephyro victa tepente fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:220" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 220</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of digestion: pervigilio quidem praecipue vincuntur cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 118, § 283</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50968.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be superior; to convince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentis vincit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincit ipsa rerum publicarum natura saepe rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 13</bibl>: si subitam et fortuitam orationem commentatio et cogitatio facile vincit; <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ipsam profecto assidua ac diligens scriptura superabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis animus vincetur et expugnabitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est consentaneum, qui invictum se a labore praestiterit, vinci a voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labascit, victu'st, uno verbo, quam cito!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eludet, ubi te victum senserit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius stultitiā victa ex urbe tu migres?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:13"
