default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulus saepe eadem audiendo victus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccavi, fateor, vincor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus patris precibus lacrimisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divūm pater victus tuis vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est qui vinci possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas Victa furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus amore pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia victa in lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus animi respexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphantes de lege victā et abrogatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo negatum, vincor, ut credam miser,</quote> <trans><tr>am constrained</tr>, <tr>compelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:27" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.12" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50968.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overmatch</hi> in some quality, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>, = superare: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum globi terrae magnitudinem facile vincebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem vicit omnium, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationem omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:5:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (noctem) edepol etiam multo haec (nox) vicit longitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum immanitate vastissimas vincit beluas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 26, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamlibet mulierculam Vincere mollitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:24" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio qui posset vincere Regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere, quod Cassi opuscula vincat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="VINC" /> 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qualia (praecepta) vincunt Pythagoran,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: vir nulli victus vel ponere castra vel junxisse ratem, etc., <hi rend="ital">excelled by none in pitching a camp</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:552" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 552</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:141" default="NO">6, 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prove triumphantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi> or <hi rend="ital">demonstrate conclusively.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50968.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc? vincon' argumentis te non esse Sosiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto ita esse, et praedico, vero vincam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vince deinde, bonum virum fuisse Oppianicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 124</bibl></cit>: dicendo vincere non postulo, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincet enim stultos ratio insanire nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 225</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vincet ratio hoc, tantundem ut peccet idemque Qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.17" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si doceo non ab Avito, vinco ab Oppianico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 23, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.18" n="3" level="3"> With respect to something disputed, <hi rend="ital">to prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain one's point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry the day.</hi> So only in the expressions, </sense><sense id="n50968.19" n="a" level="4"> Vicimus: <cit><quote lang="la">cui si esse in urbe tuto licebit, vicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpantur iniqui. Vicimus: assiduas non tulit illa preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: vicimus exclamat; <cit><quote lang="la">mecum mea vota feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicimus et meus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:356" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 356</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.20" n="b" level="4"> Vincite, viceris, vincerent, <hi rend="ital">have it your own way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as you like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry your point</hi>, an expression of reluctant assent: <cit><quote lang="la">vincite, si ita vultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 509</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincerent ac sibi haberent, dummodo scirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.21" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To treat worthily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forth with dignity</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec sum animi dubius, verbis ea vincere magnum Quam sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 289</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 733</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinctio: <entryFree id="n50969" type="main" key="vincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vincio</etym>, <sense id="n50969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ligature</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 62</bibl> Müll.; <hi rend="ital">a shoetie</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinctor: <entryFree id="n50970" type="main" key="vinctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binder</hi> (postclass.); (with congregator) <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinctura: <entryFree id="n50971" type="main" key="vinctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bandage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ligature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vincture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 68, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 62</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
vinctus: <entryFree id="n50972" type="main" key="vinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of vincio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50973" type="main" key="vinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vincio</etym>, <sense id="n50973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinctu, quod antiqui vocabant cestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinculo: <entryFree id="n50974" type="main" key="vincu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa animalia redimiculis gaudent, et phalerari sibi magis quam vinculari videntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 3, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinculum: <entryFree id="n50975" type="main" key="vincu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincŭlum</orth>, <itype>or</itype> (also in class. prose), contr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">vinclum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that with which any thing is bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi> (cf.: catena, manica, compes). </sense><sense id="n50975.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora constricta vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos et vincula rupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic fessas non vincula naves Ulla tenent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chio solvite vincla cado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicarum vincla relaxat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:321" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis Charta sit a vinclis non labefacta suis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the seal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae sua vincula dempsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae laxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennarum vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Tyrrhena pedum circumdat vincula plantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 458</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of sandals,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:66" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:410" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 410</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 324</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 823</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50975.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp. in the <number>plur.</number>, of the <hi rend="ital">fetters</hi> of prisoners, and hence sometimes to be rendered <hi rend="ital">prison;</hi> and vincula publica, <hi rend="ital">the state-prison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto vincla, mitto carcerem, mitto verbera, mitto secures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:24:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 24, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aeternis tenebris vinculisque mandare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de convivio in vincla atque in tenebras abripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>: in vincula conjectus, Caes. B. G, 3, 9; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 27: in vincula duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 49, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 56, 4</bibl>; 3, 57, 5; 5, 9, 4; 9, 34, 24; 38, 56, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7:2 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vinculis et catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ex vinculis causam dicere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to plead in chains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cim. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 26, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50975.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex corporum vinculis tamquam e carcere evolaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum ad astringendam fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">victum ingens vinculum fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula revellit non modo judiciorum, sed etiam utilitatis vitaeque communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum ingens immodicae cupiditatis injectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: quae (beneficium et gratia) <cb n="VIND" /> sunt vincula concordiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculis et propinquitatis et affinitatis conjunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincla summae conjunctionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit maximum vinculum, quod ita rem publicam geris, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vinclum, quaeso, deest nostrae conjunctioni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui me vinclo vellem jugali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 549</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusare laborem et mercenaria vincla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindelici: <entryFree id="n50976" type="main" key="Vinde^li^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vindĕlĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose chief town was Augusta Vindelicorum</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Augsburg</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl>; Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 243</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n50976.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vindĕlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Vindelici</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vindelician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:85:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 85, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 415</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50976.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vindĕ-lĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Vindelici</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vindelicia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 488</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemia: <entryFree id="n50977" type="main" key="vinde_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vinum-demo</etym>, <sense id="n50977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grape - gathering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50977.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 37</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:70" default="NO">11, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 315</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50977.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50977.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Grapes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eadem arboribus pendet vindemia nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 522</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spumat plenis vindemia labris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursi fruge, fronde, vindemiā, pomis vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 73, 93, § 199</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50977.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the time of grape-gathering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the vintage season</hi>, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:23" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 23</bibl> and 47.—</sense><sense id="n50977.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The gathering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harvest</hi> of similar things: <cit><quote lang="la">olearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemialis: <entryFree id="n50978" type="main" key="vinde_mi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vindemia</etym>, <sense id="n50978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the vintage</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ESCAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4419</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemiator: <entryFree id="n50979" type="main" key="vinde_mi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭātor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vindemio</etym>, <sense id="n50979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grape-gatherer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintager.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50979.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 94</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 30</bibl> (scanned vin-dem-ja-tor); form vindemitor, Sen. Apocol. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n50979.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a star in the constellation Virgo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Vindemitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:407" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 407</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 309</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemiatorius: <entryFree id="n50980" type="main" key="vinde_mi^a_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vindemiator</etym>, <sense id="n50980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the vintage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemio: <entryFree id="n50981" type="main" key="vinde_mi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>vindemia</etym>, <sense id="n50981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gather grapes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather the vintage</hi> (post-Aug.); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam et Calend. Jan. vindemiantes vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 319</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:310" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 37, § 310</bibl>. —With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:33:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemiola: <entryFree id="n50982" type="hapax" key="vinde_mi^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little vintage</hi>, transf., of income, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemitor: <entryFree id="n50983" type="main" key="vinde_mi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. vindemiator.</entryFree>
vindex: <entryFree id="n50984" type="main" key="vindex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>vindico</etym>. <sense id="n50984.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who lays legal claim</hi> to a thing, <hi rend="ital">a claimant;</hi> hence, also, <hi rend="ital">a maintainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vindicator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindex ab eo, quod vindicat, quominus is, qui prensus est, ab aliquo teneatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl></cit> Müll.: ASSIDVO. VINDEX. ASSIDVVS. ESTO. PROLETARIO. CIVI. QVOI. QVIS. VOLET. VINDEX. ESTO, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeat sane populus tabellam quasi vindicem libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris alieni,</quote> <trans><tr>a defender</tr>, <tr>protector of debtors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum ac libertatis (M. Brutus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae,</quote> <trans><tr>a protector from wrong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <trans><tr>in peril</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae (Hercules),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum Vindice decepto Graias misistis in urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec deus intersit, nisi dignus vindice nodus Inciderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honori posterorum tuorum ut vindex fieres,</quote> <trans><tr>a preserver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">audita vox una (provoco) vindex libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicibus pacatus viribus orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50984.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An avenger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos ac vindex cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindex ultorque parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 237</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Furiae deae ... vindices facinorum et scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Tisiphone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:80" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 80</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">vindice flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 192</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindicatio: <entryFree id="n50985" type="main" key="vindi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50985.0" n="I" level="1"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a laying claim</hi> to a thing, <hi rend="ital">a civil action</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lawsuit</hi> for a thing, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 24</bibl>; <pb n="1993" /> <cb n="VIND" /> 4, 16 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">De rei vindicatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, tit. 1: intestatorum civium concessam vindicationem bonorum adfirmare, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50985.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking into protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vindication: an avenging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi> of an offence: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicatio est, per quam vim et contumeliam defendendo aut ulciscendo propulsamus a nobis et a nostris, qui nobis esse cari debent: et per quam peccata punimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 53, 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindicator: <entryFree id="n50986" type="main" key="vindi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vindico</etym>, <sense id="n50986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an avenger</hi> (eccl. Lat.), S. S. Psa. 8, 3 ap. Aug.</sense></entryFree>
vindicia: <entryFree id="n50987" type="main" key="vindi^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vindiciae <sense id="n50987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vindiciae: <entryFree id="n50988" type="main" key="vindi^ci^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭcĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (in <number>sing.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭ-cĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl> Müll.; cf. Serv. Sulp. ib. and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 8</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vindico</etym>, <sense id="n50988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying claim to</hi> a thing before the praetor by both contending parties (hence in <number>plur.</number>); <hi rend="ital">a legal claim</hi> made in respect to a thing, whether as one's own property, or for its restoration to a free condition: <cit><quote lang="la">vindiciae appellantur res eae, de quibus controversia ... Ser. Sulpicius (vocabulo) jam singulariter formato vindiciam ait esse, quā de re controversia est, ab eo quod vindicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicia, id est correptio manūs in re atque in loco praesenti apud Praetorem ex duodecim tabulis fiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: SI VINDICIAM FALSAM TVLIT REI SIVE LITIS, i. e. <hi rend="ital">has falsely obtained possession of the thing claimed</hi>, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">aut pro praede litis vindiciarum cum satis accepisset, sponsionem faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injustis vindiciis ac sacramentis alienos fundos petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicias ab libertate in servitutem dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to sentence a free person to slavery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 57, 5</bibl>; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: quo (ore) vindiciae nuper ab libertate dictae erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores secundum populum vindicias dicunt, Cato ap. Fest. l. l.: decrēsse vindicias secundum servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Claudio clienti negotium dedit, ut virginem in servitutem assereret neque cederet secundum libertatem postulantibus vindicias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to those who demanded her liberation</tr>, <tr>her liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 44, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of the praetor: lege ab ipso lata vindicias det secundum libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 44, 12</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decemviri Romae sine provocatione fuerunt, tertio illo anno, cum vindicias amisisset ipsa libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindicius: <entryFree id="n50989" type="main" key="Vindi^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vindĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the slave who discovered the conspiracy to restore the Tarquins</hi>, Liv 2, 5, 10 Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
vindico: <entryFree id="n50990" type="main" key="vindi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭco</orth> (on account of a supposed derivation from venum - dico, also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭco</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (collat. form, acc. to the 3d conj., VINDICIT, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vim - dico, prop. to assert authority, viz. in a case where legal possession of a thing claimed is refused; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n50990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay legal claim to</hi> a thing, whether as one's own property or for its restoration to a free condition. </sense><sense id="n50990.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: IN. IVS. DVCITO. NI IVDICATVM FACIT AVT QVIS ENDO EOM IVRE VINDICIT, i. e. eum in jure vindicat, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 45</bibl>; cf., on the form of laying claim to disputed personal property, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicare sponsam in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 48, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 46, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita vindicatur Virginia spondentibus propinquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50990.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. (freq. and class.; cf. assero). </sense><sense id="n50990.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay claim to as one's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a claim upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">claim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia non Quiritium sed sapientium jure pro suis vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videor id meo jure quodam modo vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerum ... Chii suum vindicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortūs nostri partem patria vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam partem quasi suo jure Fortuna sibi vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterarum rerum quae sunt in oratore, partem aliquam sibi quisque vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod neque summi imperatores ... sibi umquam vindicare sunt ausi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">14: partem oneris tui mihi vindico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:42:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partis sibi aequas potentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:30:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Helv. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO">5, 3</bibl>, ext. 2; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:8:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl>: iniquissima haec bellorum condicio est; <cb n="VIND" /> prospera omnes sibi vindicant, adversa uni imputantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae majore parte ad se vindicatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus belli ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 43, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta tamen universae Galliae consensio fuit libertatis vindicandae, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>should be maintained</tr>, <tr>vindicated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trasimenum pro Tarsimeno multi auctores ... vindicaverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have adopted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicet antiquam faciem, vultusque ferinos Detrahat,</quote> <trans><tr>reassume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 523</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicat hoc Pharius dextrā gestare satelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 675</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50990.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To place</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in a free condition.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50990.5" n="1" level="3"> In libertatem vindicare, <hi rend="ital">to set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emancipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libertatem rem populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex dominatu Ti. Gracchi in libertatem rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 58, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam afflictam et oppressam in veterem dignitatem ac libertatem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se et populum Romanum in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50990.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ab eo vindico et libero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos a verberibus, ab unco, a crucis terrore neque res gestae neque acta aetas neque vestri honores vindicabunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia sola nos a libidinum impetu et formidinum terrore vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin ab hoc ignotissimo Phryge nobilissimum civem vindicetis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a miseriis morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:329" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a molestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum suam a solitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem summorum oratorum ab oblivione hominum atque a silentio,</quote> <trans><tr>rescue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ab hac necessitate egregie vos fortuna vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora a putrescendo (sal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur a carie (vetus oleum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum a canitie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se non modo ex suspitione tanti sceleris, verum etiam ex omni hominum sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetienda illa fuerunt, ut se aliquando ad suos vindicaret,</quote> <trans><tr>might restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam dura ad saxa revinctam Vindicat Alcides,</quote> <trans><tr>sets free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem absolutus vindicatusque est (reus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50990.7" n="C" level="2"> With respect to some wrong perpetrated (cf. ulciscor), <hi rend="ital">to avenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punish; to take vengeance</hi> on any one; <hi rend="ital">make compensation for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae vindicaris in altero, sibi ipsi vehementer fugienda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maleficium in aliis vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus in nullo etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolum malum et legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>. acerrime maleficia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensionem improborum supplicio omni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam rem quam vehementer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ti. Gracchi conatus perditos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem Crassi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:468" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensas ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuita non civium tantummodo sed urbium damna principis munificentia vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:126:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 126, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor non modo in socios, sed etiam in cives militesque nostros persaepe esse severe ac vehementer vindicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicandum in eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicatum in eos, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos (Venetos) eo gravius Caesar vindicandum statuit, quo diligentius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50990.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (after the analogy of ulcisci): vindicare se ab (de) aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to revenge one's self upon</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se de fortunā praefationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantā saevitiā opus erat, ut Sulla de Mario vindicaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindicta: <entryFree id="n50991" type="main" key="vindicta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindicta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vindico</etym>, <sense id="n50991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the staff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rod with which a slave was touched in the ceremony of manumission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a liberating-rod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manumission - staff.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50991.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si neque censu neque vindictā nec testamento liber factus est, non est liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quoque servari, modo quam vindicta redemit, Quis ferat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 615</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:88" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 16, 4</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 17 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50991.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n50991.3" n="A" level="2"> (Cf. vindico, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">A means of asserting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vindication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence;</hi> esp. with libertatis: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas in ipsā vindictā libertatis peritura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindictam aliquam libertatis suae quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 37, 10</bibl></cit>: utrique <cb n="VINU" /> vindicta libertatis morte stetit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:64:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 64, 3</bibl>. —In other connections: <cit><quote lang="la">petatur a virtute invisae hujus vitae vindicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors, inquit, una vindicta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis severae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50991.4" n="B" level="2"> (Cf. vindico, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Vengeance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi> (syn. ultio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 29, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:180" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:191" default="NO">13, 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinea: <entryFree id="n50992" type="main" key="vi_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vineus, II.</entryFree>
vinealis: <entryFree id="n50993" type="main" key="vi_ne^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinea</etym>, <sense id="n50993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>land suitable for planting vines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinearius: <entryFree id="n50994" type="main" key="vi_ne^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <trans><tr>vine-hills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <trans><tr>vineyards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:198" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vineaticus: <entryFree id="n50995" type="main" key="vi_ne^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <trans><tr>vintage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falculae,</quote> <trans><tr>vine-dressers' knives</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinetum: <entryFree id="n50996" type="main" key="vi_ne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n50996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plantation of vines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vineyard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 37</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:167" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 167</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 36, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 319</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:2" default="NO">12, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl>.—Prov.: vineta sua caedere, i. q. <hi rend="ital">to be severe against one's self</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 220</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vineus: <entryFree id="n50997" type="main" key="vi_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to wine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50997.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (so very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">latex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50997.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50997.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plantation of vines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vineyard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 390</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 29 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n50997.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:5" default="NO">4, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50997.5" n="C" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a kind of penthouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">mantlet</hi>, built like an arbor, for sheltering besiegers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21</bibl>; 7, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:110 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 110 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 15</bibl>: sub vineam jacere dicuntur milites, cum astantibus centurionibus jacere coguntur sudes, Fest. s. v. sub, p. 311 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
vinibua: <entryFree id="n50998" type="hapax" key="vi_ni^bu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĭbŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vinum - and bu-; cf.: imbuo, bibo</etym>, <sense id="n50998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female wine-bibber</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 81, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinifer: <entryFree id="n50999" type="hapax" key="vi_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinumfero</etym>, <sense id="n50999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine-producing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinitor: <entryFree id="n51000" type="main" key="vi_ni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n51000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vine-dresser</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinitorius: <entryFree id="n51001" type="hapax" key="vi_ni^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinitor</etym>, <sense id="n51001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a vine-dresser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <trans><tr>a vinedresser's knife</tr>, <tr>pruning-hook</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinnulus: <entryFree id="n51002" type="hapax" key="vinnu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinnŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. for venerula from Venus</etym>, <sense id="n51002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio vinnula, venustula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinolentia: <entryFree id="n51003" type="main" key="vi_no^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vinolentus</etym>, <sense id="n51003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winebibbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxication from wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 20, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinolentus: <entryFree id="n51004" type="main" key="vi_no^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnŏlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n51004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drunk with wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sobrius in violentiam vinolentorum incidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <trans><tr>strongly mixed with wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinositas: <entryFree id="n51005" type="main" key="vi_no_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vinosus</etym>, <sense id="n51005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flavor of wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
vinosus: <entryFree id="n51006" type="main" key="vi_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n51006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk with wine; fond of wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winebibbing</hi> (syn.: temulentus, ebrius): non modo vinosus, sed virosus quoque, Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus arguitur vini vinosus Homerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modice vinosi,</quote> <trans><tr>drunken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 330</bibl>: moris sucus in carne vinosus, <hi rend="ital">having the taste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flavor of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 27, § 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor seminis nardi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 13, 27, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor seminis ambrosiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus Punicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:765" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 765</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinum: <entryFree id="n51007" type="main" key="vi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (in vulg. lang. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41, 12</bibl>; cf. Schol. Bern. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 98</bibl>) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>], <sense id="n51007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51007.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 23, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 265</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini minister,</quote> <trans><tr>butler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: vina, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 274</bibl>; also, esp., <hi rend="ital">sorts of wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wines</hi>, Cato, <pb n="1994" /> <cb n="VIOL" /> R. R. 147 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 6, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina tot consulum regionumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51007.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51007.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Grapes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum pendens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum priusque coctum est pendet putidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 94</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n51007.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus vino optimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51007.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wine made of fruits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:103" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 16, 19, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:52" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 26, § 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mart. 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vio: <entryFree id="n51008" type="main" key="vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>via</etym>, <sense id="n51008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel</hi> (postAug. and very rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vio pro eo infelicius fictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 33</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">legati intenti ad viandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter viandi multifidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vians maritus,</quote> <trans><tr>travelling about</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 240</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 184; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 24, 4</bibl>.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭantes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">travellers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viantibus opportunae viae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viocurus: <entryFree id="n51009" type="main" key="vi^o^cu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏcūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>via-curo</etym>, <sense id="n51009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overseer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constructor of roads</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl>, §§ 7 and 158 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
viola: <entryFree id="n51010" type="main" key="vi^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/on</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n51010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the violet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the stock-gillyflower.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51010.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 14, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:64" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 38, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 39</bibl>. —Collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">an tu me in violā putabas aut in rosā dicere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:26:73 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 26, 73 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n51010.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A violet color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:121" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 40, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
violabilis: <entryFree id="n51011" type="main" key="vi^o^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>violo</etym>, <sense id="n51011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be injured</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cor levibus telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non violabile numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba nullis armis, senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:258" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 258</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
