violaceus: <entryFree id="n51012" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viola, II.</etym>, <sense id="n51012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violet-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violet</hi>: purpura, Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 63, § 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violacium: <entryFree id="n51013" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlācĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>viola</etym>, <sense id="n51013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violet-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
violaris: <entryFree id="n51014" type="gloss" key="vi^o^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to violets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violet-</hi>: DIE, <hi rend="ital">the day on which graves were garlanded with violets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roses</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 724, 443</bibl>; cf. rosales.</sense></entryFree>
violarium: <entryFree id="n51015" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bank of violets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:437" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 437</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:259" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
violarius: <entryFree id="n51016" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>viola, II.</etym>, <sense id="n51016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dyer of violet color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 36</bibl>; Inscr. Don. cl. 8, n. 78.</sense></entryFree>
violatio: <entryFree id="n51017" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>violo</etym>, <sense id="n51017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violation</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violator: <entryFree id="n51018" type="main" key="vi^o^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an injurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profaner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violator</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatoris (C. Caesaris),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>murderer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—In apposit., <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natrix violator aquae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>polluting</tr>, <tr>poisoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 720</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violatrix: <entryFree id="n51019" type="main" key="vi^o^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>violator</etym>, <sense id="n51019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who profanes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Mor. Manich. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violatus: <entryFree id="n51020" type="main" key="vi^o^la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of violo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51021" type="main" key="vi^o^la_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viola</etym>, <sense id="n51021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flavored with violets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violens: <entryFree id="n51022" type="main" key="vi^o^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vis</etym>, <sense id="n51022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, whereas violentus is class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Aufidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (with ferus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:171" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violenter: <entryFree id="n51023" type="main" key="vi^o^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>violens</etym>, <sense id="n51023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impetuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>: solennia ludorum violenter dirimere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio exercita aspere violenterque,</quote> <trans><tr>furiously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidimus flavum Tiberim retortis Litore Etrusco violenter undis Ire dejectum monumenta regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invadunt appropinquantem (canes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proconsulatum violenter gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad supplicium poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 25, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
violentia: <entryFree id="n51024" type="main" key="vi^o^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>violentus</etym>, <sense id="n51024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuosity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferocity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illi hanc vim appellant, quae est potius violentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi hominis furorem, novi effrenatam violentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinolentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 118</bibl></cit>: minis ejus ac violentiā territus, Suet. Ner. <cb n="VIPE" /> 34: <cit><quote lang="la">gentium,</quote> <trans><tr>ferocity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acris leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 741</bibl></cit>.—Of things, concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe fortunae violentiam toleravisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radii solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultūs,</quote> <trans><tr>fierceness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dolo nihil profecerit, vi et violentiā deicere eos conatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 29, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violentus: <entryFree id="n51025" type="main" key="vi^o^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vis</etym>, <sense id="n51025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forcible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boisterous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi id rescivit factum frater violentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo vehemens et violentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis sis, ut es, violentus et furens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus saevissimus et violentissimus in suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 46, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Piso ingenio violentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciē violenta Corinna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentus in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:964" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 964</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucania bellum Incuteret violenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:368" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1231" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentior Eurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentior amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentissimae tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:49:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 49, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentissimus caeli status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae res violentissimae, ferrum et ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors infantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1172" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis violentum est, nulla esse dicere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it is unreasonable</tr>, <tr>it is going too far</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 72</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
violeus: <entryFree id="n51026" type="main" key="vi^o^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viola</etym>, <sense id="n51026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a violet color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violo: <entryFree id="n51027" type="main" key="vi^o^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vis</etym>, <sense id="n51027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to treat with violence</hi> (corporeally, and, more freq., mentally), <hi rend="ital">to injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi> (cf.: laedo, polluo, contamino). </sense><sense id="n51027.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> with persons as objects: <cit><quote lang="la">hospites violare fas non putant,</quote> <trans><tr>to injure</tr>, <tr>do violence to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam prodere, parentes violare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: virginem, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=80" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 80</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:51" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 51</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum vulnere corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 591</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Getico peream violatus ab arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 5, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51027.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51027.3" n="A" level="2"> With places as objects, <hi rend="ital">to invade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines eorum se violaturum negavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca religiosa et lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliacos agros ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereale nemus securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva vetus nullāque diu violata securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:649" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 649</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51027.4" n="B" level="2"> With the senses as objects, <hi rend="ital">to outrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos nostros (tua epistola),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aures meas obsceno sermone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51027.5" n="C" level="2"> With abstract objects, <hi rend="ital">to violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injure</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginitatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducias per scelus,</quote> <trans><tr>to break</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationem absentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis nostri famam tuis probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:32:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 32, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem alicujus in aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae sunt, quae aut pulsatione corpus aut convicio aures aut aliquā turpitudine vitam cujuspiam violant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 25, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51027.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Indum sanguineo ostro ebur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dye of a blood-red</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl></cit> (an imitation of the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">e)le/fanta foi/niki mih/nh</foreign>, Il. 4, 141).</sense></entryFree>
vipera: <entryFree id="n51028" type="main" key="vi_pe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from vivipera, from vivus-pario, that brings forth living young</etym>, <sense id="n51028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a viper.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51028.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Coluber berus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 62, 82, § 169</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51028.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51028.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 417</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 421</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:376 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 376 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sinu viperam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:24:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 24, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viperam nutricare sub alā,</quote> <trans><tr>to nourish a viper in one's bosom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77</bibl></cit>: vipera est in vepreculā, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 231, 13</bibl>; v. veprecula.—</sense><sense id="n51028.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Viper! serpent!</hi> as a term of reproach for a dangerous person: <cit><quote lang="la">saevissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:641" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem, vipera, sibilare desiste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:37" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viperalis: <entryFree id="n51029" type="main" key="vi_pe^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vipera</etym>, <sense id="n51029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for vipers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>good against the bite of a viper</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 89</bibl></cit>. <cb n="VIR" /></sense></entryFree>
vipereus: <entryFree id="n51030" type="main" key="vi_pe^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vipera</etym>, <sense id="n51030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a viper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">snake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:203" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:769" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 635</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the serpent-haired head of Medusa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 615</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Furies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:662" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>winged serpents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:391" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 391</bibl></cit>: genus fratrum, <hi rend="ital">sprung from the dragon's teeth</hi> of Cadmus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 597" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans><tr>with serpent fingers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>poisonous breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 351</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viperinus: <entryFree id="n51031" type="main" key="vi_pe^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n51031.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of a viper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">snake.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51031.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 279</bibl></cit>: morsus, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodo coërces viperino Bistonidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51031.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (herba), <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> serpentaria, <hi rend="ital">dragonwort</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51031.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Serpent - formed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent-like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda (chamaeleonis) implicans se viperinis orbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vipio: <entryFree id="n51032" type="main" key="vipi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vipĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small crane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 69, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vipsanius: <entryFree id="n51033" type="main" key="Vipsa_nius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vipsānius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. M. Vipsanius Agrippa,</quote> <trans><tr>the son-inlaw of Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit> and 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vipsānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vipsanius Agrippa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vipsanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae, in the portico of Agrippa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:18:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:109:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 109, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vir: <entryFree id="n51034" type="main" key="vi^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭr</orth>, <itype>vĭri</itype> (<sense id="n51034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> virūm, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 251</bibl> P., or Ann. v. 280 Vahl.; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl> Müll., or Ann. v. 394 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:553 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 553 al.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. vira, hero; the root is in O. H. Germ. weralt; Angl.Sax. veruld; Engl. world, i. e. age or generation of men</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a male person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a man</hi> (opp. femina; cf. mas). </sense><sense id="n51034.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">virum me natam vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deque viro factus (mirabile') femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguus fuerit modo vir, modo femina Sithon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:280" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier conjuncta viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1012" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1012</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir mulierque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientissimorum nostrae civitatis virorum disputatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir prudens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clari viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir clarus et honoratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus et sapiens et legibus parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. bonus: optimi (opp. homines improbi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 498</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51034.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A man</hi> as related to a woman, <hi rend="ital">a husband</hi>, maritus (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">is (Juppiter) amare occepit Alcumenam clam virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">134</bibl>; 1, 3, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (vultum) dicitur Xanthippe praedicare solita in viro suo fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 31, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:127 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 127 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:28" default="NO">5, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:28" default="NO">7, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 22 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, <hi rend="ital">the male</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mate</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 660</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A man</hi> (opp. a boy): <cit><quote lang="la">pueri hoc possunt, viri non potuerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex toto non sic pueri ut viri curari debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueroque viroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eos (pueros) prius in urbem redire, quam viri facti essent, statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum essem parvulus ... quando factus sum vir, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.5" n="C" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a man of courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principle</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who deserves the name of a man</hi>: Marius rusticanus vir, sed plane vir, cum secaretur, vetuit se alligari ... Ita et tulit dolorem, ut vir; <cit><quote lang="la">et, ut homo, majorem ferre sine causā necessariā noluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is jam se corroboravisset ac vir inter viros esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te oro, te colligas virumque praebeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: si vir esse volet, praeclara <foreign lang="greek">sunodi/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum viro et gubernatore opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 46, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 38, 6 et saep.: si quid in Flacco viri est, Non feret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.6" n="D" level="2"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n51034.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen., like our <hi rend="ital">man</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">soldier</hi> (syn. miles): <cit><quote lang="la">dispertiti viri, dispertiti ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">boat Caelum fremitu virum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: vir <pb n="1995" /> <cb n="VIRE" /> unus cum viro congrediendo, T. Manlius, M. Valerius, quantum Gallicam rabiem vinceret Romana virtus, docuerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic., as opposed to the cavalry, <hi rend="ital">a foot-soldier</hi> (syn. pedes): <cit><quote lang="la">equites virique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā voce trahens equitemque virosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:559" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passim turmaeque virique, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl></cit>.—Hence, prov.: equis viris, or viris equisque, <hi rend="ital">with horse and foot</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with might and main;</hi> v. equus.—</sense><sense id="n51034.9" n="E" level="2"> With emphasis in place of a pronoun of reference, is, ille, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">fletusque et conploratio fregere tandem virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae tantae viri virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.10" n="F" level="1"> Distributively, <hi rend="ital">each man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir virum legit, of choosing a senator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir cum viro congrediaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: legitque virum vir, <hi rend="ital">singled out</hi> (in battle), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 632</bibl> (an imitation of Hom. Il. 4, 472: <foreign lang="greek">a)nh\r d) a)/ndr) e)dnopa/lizen</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum vir virum legisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a companion in battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 39, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in a sarcastic transfer-: ille (Clodius), qui semper secum scorta, semper exoletos, semper lupas ducebat, tum neminem, nisi ut virum a viro lectum esse diceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.11" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Human beings</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> homines, opp. pecudes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 286</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 553</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.12" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Manhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virility</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut relicta sensit sibi membra sine viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro mollita juventus Atque exsecta virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vira: <entryFree id="n51035" type="main" key="vi^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nunc femina, antiquitus vira vocabatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virago: <entryFree id="n51036" type="main" key="vi^ra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man-like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heroic maiden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female warrior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heroine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virago</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">virago aliqua ancilla,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>vigorous</tr>, <tr>stout</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: vos etenim juvenes animum geritis muliebrem, Illa virago viri, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>: virago Paluda, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Minerva</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 37</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 510 Vahl.); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 765</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:23" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:414" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 11, 414</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippcl. 54" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippcl. 54</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Juturna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 468</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">an Amazon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Eve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viratus: <entryFree id="n51037" type="main" key="vi^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a manly spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>: vir, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 187, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 28, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51038" type="hapax" key="vi^ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manly conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manliness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virbius: <entryFree id="n51039" type="main" key="Virbi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virbĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n51039.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of Hippolytus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 544</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:756" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 756</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51039.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The surname of a son of Hippolytus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 762</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virdicatus: <entryFree id="n51040" type="main" key="virdi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, sync. for viridicatus, q. v.</entryFree>
virdumarus: <entryFree id="n51041" type="main" key="Virdu^ma^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virdŭmărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader of the Insubres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 10, 41; Fast. Capitol. ap. Grut. 297, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; v. Viridomarus.</sense></entryFree>
virectum: <entryFree id="n51042" type="main" key="vi^rectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrectum</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrētum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vireo</etym>, <sense id="n51042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place overgrown with grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a green place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greensward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turf</hi>: viretum, <foreign lang="greek">a)nqw=n to/pos</foreign>, Gloss.; mostly in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">virecta nemorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoena virecta, of Paradise,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latissima, Apol. M. 4, p. 143, 2: patentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 209 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 10, p. 263, 24.—</sense><sense id="n51042.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">greenness</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythidis (i. e. smaragdi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virens: <entryFree id="n51043" type="main" key="vi^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of vireo.—As <sense id="n51043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">plants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herbage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:8" default="NO">1, 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vireo: <entryFree id="n51044" type="main" key="vi^re^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n51044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be green</hi> or <hi rend="ital">verdant</hi> (syn. viridor). </sense><sense id="n51044.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia semper virent, alia, hieme nudatā, verno tempore tepefacta frondescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fronde virere novā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo viret uva jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 78: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pubes hederā virente Gaudeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa (montis) pinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:382" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 837</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna musco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa ilicibus virentem Alburnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora felle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 777</bibl></cit>: metalla Taygeti, of <hi rend="ital">the green Spartan marble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:76:9" default="NO">9, 76, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51044.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lively; to flourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vegetum ingenium vivido pectore vigebat, virebatque integris sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum virent genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas populi Romani viruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut novus serpens ... solet squamā virere recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virium gloriā virente florere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51045" type="main" key="vi^re^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bird;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">the greenfinch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 292</bibl>. <cb n="VIRG" /></sense></entryFree>
vires: <entryFree id="n51046" type="main" key="vi_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. vis.</entryFree>
viresco: <entryFree id="n51047" type="main" key="vi^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n51047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [1. vireo], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become green</hi> or <hi rend="ital">verdant.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 394</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 29, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 54" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, 127</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n51047.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shoot forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be developed</hi>, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 63 (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 674</bibl> the correct read. is vigescat; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 757</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n51047.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To flourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani adulescentia, quā maxime viruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: virescit vulnere virtus, Furius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 4</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 188, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viretum: <entryFree id="n51048" type="main" key="vi^re_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrētum</orth>, v. virectum.</entryFree>
virga: <entryFree id="n51049" type="main" key="virga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root varg; v. virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slender green branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">switch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rod.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51049.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51049.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:172" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 112, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51049.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A graft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 630</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A limetwig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 474</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">switch</hi> for flogging, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for governing horses, etc.: virga quā ad regendum equum usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:4:5:16" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 4, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis equus umbrā quoque virgae regitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:22:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 22, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 683</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:317" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 317</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the small rods in the fasces of the lictors</hi>, with which criminals were scourged, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 136</bibl>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, for fasces, as a designation of one of the higher magistrates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:47" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:66:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 66, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A wand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a staff</hi>, as a support, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:706" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 706</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A magic wand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 278</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 295</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 300</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51049.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A stalk</hi> of the flax-plant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A streak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stripe</hi> in the heavens, <hi rend="ital">a water-gall</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 9</bibl> and 10.—</sense><sense id="n51049.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A colored stripe</hi> in a garment: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 269</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51049.13" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A twig</hi> or <hi rend="ital">branch</hi> of the ancestral tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.14" n="E" level="2"> Genitalium, = membrum virile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Anim, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgator: <entryFree id="n51050" type="hapax" key="virga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>virga</etym>, <sense id="n51050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who beats with rods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flogger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgatus: <entryFree id="n51051" type="main" key="virga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n51051.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Made of twigs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">osiers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calathisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 320</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51051.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to virga, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Striped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:155" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 344" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 344</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 146</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virgato corpore tigris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:148" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus,</quote> <trans><tr>in striped garments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:159" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virgetum: <entryFree id="n51052" type="hapax" key="virge_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thicket of rods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">osiers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgeus: <entryFree id="n51053" type="main" key="virge^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of rods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of brushwood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anuli ex myrto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>of brush set on fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virgidemia: <entryFree id="n51054" type="main" key="virgi^de_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭdēmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formed from virga, after the analogy of vindemia</etym>, <sense id="n51054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harvest of rods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of stripes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 22</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 187, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgiliae: <entryFree id="n51055" type="main" key="Virgi^li^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭlĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. Vergiliae.</entryFree>
virgilianus: <entryFree id="n51056" type="main" key="Virgi^li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Vergilius.</entryFree>
virgiliocento: <entryFree id="n51057" type="main" key="Virgi^li^o^cento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭlĭŏcento</orth>, v. Vergiliocento.</entryFree>
virgilius: <entryFree id="n51058" type="main" key="Virgi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭlĭus</orth>, v. Vergilius.</entryFree>
virginal: <entryFree id="n51059" type="main" key="virgi^nal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, v. virginalis, II.</entryFree>
virginalis: <entryFree id="n51060" type="main" key="virgi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a maiden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maidenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virginal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51060.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus, vestitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: modestia, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 11, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 32</bibl>: ploratus, <hi rend="ital">a wailing like a girl</hi>, id. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 21: <cit><quote lang="la">feles,</quote> <trans><tr>a girl-stealer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">virginarius: Fortuna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Venus</tr>, <tr>as the tutelary goddess of maidens</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 91</bibl></cit> (cf. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 25</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n51060.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = pudenda muliebria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 14</bibl>; also in the form virginal, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 14, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>: virginalia, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8.</sense></entryFree>
virginarius: <entryFree id="n51061" type="hapax" key="virgi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to virgins</hi>: feles, <hi rend="ital">virgin-cat</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">virgin-stealer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 9, 14</bibl>; cf. virginalis.</sense></entryFree>
